en: Surely God is good to Israel, Even to such as are pure in heart.
hmr: Pathien chu Israelhai chungah a lo ṭha ngei a, Lungrila inthienghai chunga chun.

en: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; My steps had well nigh slipped.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, kei chun chu ka sirpel vâng vâng a, Ka ke pênhai hi ân tlêu vâng vâng a nih.

en: For I was envious at the arrogant, When I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
hmr: Mi rilohai vângneizie ka hmuin, Mi uonghai chu kân hnar sih a.

en: For there are no pangs in their death; But their strength is firm.
hmr: An thi lai chun tuorna hrim an nei nawh a, An hrâtna chu a det lem hman hman a.

en: They are not in trouble as other men; Neither are they plagued like other men.
hmr: Mi dang anga rinumin an um nawh a, Mi dang sawisakin an um bawk nawh.

en: Therefore pride is as a chain about their neck; Violence covereth them as a garment.
hmr: Chuleiin, chapona chun khai- diet angin an rîng a zem a, Nunsietna chun silfên angin a tuom a.

en: Their eyes stand out with fatness: They have more than heart could wish.
hmr: Thâu leiin an mit a pâwng a, Lungrila duthusam nêka nasa an nei a.

en: They scoff, and in wickedness utter oppression: They speak loftily.
hmr: An innuisan a, suoltakin nêksâwrna thu an hril a; Chapotakin an ṭawng hlak.

en: They have set their mouth in the heavens, And their tongue walketh through the earth.
hmr: An bau chu vânahai khin an sieh a, An lei chun hnuoi hi a fang thleng hlak.

en: Therefore his people return hither: And waters of a full cup are drained by them.
hmr: Chuleiin, a mihai chu chutaka chun an kîr nâwk a, Tui noa sip chu anni idâwn fai rêtin a um a.

en: And they say, How doth God know? And is there knowledge in the Most High?
hmr: “Pathienin iengtin am hrieng a ta? Achunghnungtak chun hrietna a nei ding am a nih?” an tih a.

en: Behold, these are the wicked; And, being alway at ease, they increase in riches.
hmr: En ta, hienghai hi mi rilohai an ni hi, Inhawitirtaka umin an hausa deu deu hlak.

en: Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart, And washed my hands in innocency;
hmr: A thlâwn elin a nih, ka lungril hi ka sukfai a, Ka kuthai demkailonaa ka sâwp chu.

en: For all the day long have I been plagued, And chastened every morning.
hmr: Sûnnithlâkin sawisakin ka um a, Tûk tin kâwkin ka um sih a.

en: If I had said, I will speak thus; Behold, I had dealt treacherously with the generation of thy children.
hmr: “Chuong ang chun hril ka tih,” lo ti ta inla, Ngai ta, i nauhai thlahai chunga vervêktaka lo thaw nîng ka tih.

en: When I thought how I might know this, It was too painful for me;
hmr: Chu chu ka hriet theina ding zie ka ngaituo chun, Ka ta dingin a na taluo a nih.

en: Until I went into the sanctuary of God, And considered their latter end.
hmr: Pathien hmun inthienga ka lût a, An tâwpna ding ka ngaituo hma chun.

en: Surely thou settest them in slippery places: Thou castest them down to destruction.
hmr: Anni chu hmun innâltakahai i sie ngei a, Sietnaahai i pei thlâk hlak.

en: How are they become a desolation in a moment! They are utterly consumed with terrors.
hmr: Iengtizieha mitkhapkâr chaua an rêm el am a ni aw! Thil râpthlâktakhaia sukbo- hmang daiin an um ta a ni hi.

en: As a dream when one awaketh, So, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou wilt despise their image.
hmr: Miin meng hnunga mang an ngainêp angin, Aw LALPA, i har pha chun anni hlimthla chu ngainêp i tih.

en: For my soul was grieved, And I was pricked in my heart:
hmr: Ka lungril hi a lungngai a, Ka lungrila khawm sûn angin ka um sih a.

en: So brutish was I, and ignorant; I was as a beast before thee.
hmr: Mi mâwl le iengkhawm hre lo ka na, I kuoma chun sa ang el ka ni hiel hlak kha.

en: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: Thou hast holden my right hand.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, i kuomah ka um rawp a, Ka kut changtieng hi i lo chel hlak.

en: Thou wilt guide me with thy counsel, And afterward receive me to glory.
hmr: Nangin i remruotnain mi ṭhuoi i ta, Chu hnunga chun ropuinaa khin mi lâwm i tih.

en: Whom have I in heaven but thee? And there is none upon earth that I desire besides thee.
hmr: Vâna khin nang naw chu tu am ka nei a? Hnuoia khawm hin nang naw chu ka dit tukhawm an um nawh.

en: My flesh and my heart faileth; But God is the strength of my heart and my portion for ever.
hmr: Ka taksa le ka lungril hi a chau tah a, Nisienlakhawm, Pathien chu kumkhuoa ka lungril hrâtna ding le ka chanvo a nih.

en: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: Thou hast destroyed all them that play the harlot, departing from thee.
hmr: Ngai ta, nangma hlata umhai chu an bohmang ding a ni sih a, A uiret santu taphawt che chu i sukbohmang tah a.

en: But it is good for me to draw near unto God: I have made the Lord Jehovah my refuge, That I may tell of all thy works.
hmr: Keia ta ding chun Pathien hnai hi a ṭha a nih; LALPA Pathien chu kân hum- himna dingin ka hmang a, I sinthaw po po thu ka hril theina dingin.
